poem:
**Fragmented Vision**

Through broken light,
the eye loses trust—  
outsourced hands 
scatter care
like cataracts  
clouding clear sight.

Beneath the knife,
profits gleam,
while public eyes  
bewail the cost.

In corridors,  
hope flickers,
an old flame  
sputtering.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Eye doctors say private cataract operations have hurt the NHS The vast majority of eye doctors believe increased outsourcing of cataract operations to private clinics in England in recent years has negatively affected their NHS departments, research has found. Almost three-quarters of ophthalmologists surveyed said that outsourcing of cataracts to the private sector had a negative impact on their NHS eye care departments, with 54% flagging a large negative impact and 16% a small one.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
